com.samskivert.servlet

Class MessageManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samskivert.servlet.MessageManager

  • public class MessageManager
extends Object
    The message manager handles the translation messages for a web application. The webapp should construct the message manager with the name of its message properties file and it can then make use of the message manager to generate locale specific messages for a request.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MessageManager(String bundlePath, Locale deflocale, SiteIdentifier siteIdent)
      Constructs a message manager with the specified bundle path.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activateSiteSpecificMessages(String siteBundlePath, SiteResourceLoader siteLoader)
      If the message manager is to be used in a multi-site environment, it can be configured to load site-specific message resources in addition to the default application message resources.
      boolean exists(HttpServletRequest req, String path)
      Return true if the specifed path exists in the resource bundle.
      String getMessage(HttpServletRequest req, String path)
      Looks up the message with the specified path in the resource bundle most appropriate for the locales described as preferred by the request.
      String getMessage(HttpServletRequest req, String path, Object[] args)
      Looks up the message with the specified path in the resource bundle most appropriate for the locales described as preferred by the request, then substitutes the supplied arguments into that message using a MessageFormat object.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageManager

        public MessageManager(String bundlePath,
                      Locale deflocale,
                      SiteIdentifier siteIdent)
        Constructs a message manager with the specified bundle path. The message manager will be instantiating a ResourceBundle with the supplied path, so it should conform to the naming conventions defined by that class.
        Parameters:
        siteIdent - an optional site identifier that can be used to identify the site via which an http request was made.
        See Also:
        ResourceBundle

    • Method Detail

      • activateSiteSpecificMessages

        public void activateSiteSpecificMessages(String siteBundlePath,
                                         SiteResourceLoader siteLoader)
        If the message manager is to be used in a multi-site environment, it can be configured to load site-specific message resources in addition to the default application message resources. It must be configured with the facilities to load site-specific resources by a call to this function.
        Parameters:
        siteBundlePath - the path to the site-specific message resources.
        siteLoader - a site-specific resource loader, properly configured with a site identifier.

      • exists

        public boolean exists(HttpServletRequest req,
                      String path)
        Return true if the specifed path exists in the resource bundle.

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage(HttpServletRequest req,
                         String path)
        Looks up the message with the specified path in the resource bundle most appropriate for the locales described as preferred by the request. Always reports missing paths.

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage(HttpServletRequest req,
                         String path,
                         Object[] args)
        Looks up the message with the specified path in the resource bundle most appropriate for the locales described as preferred by the request, then substitutes the supplied arguments into that message using a MessageFormat object.
        See Also:
        MessageFormat
